definition: to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Blade all trapped in floor, off the water DuanLiang, disappointment extremely.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋众人困于楼中，断水断粮，失望至极。

sentences.english: We shall wait the enemy out, and watch them starve.
sentences.chinese: 我们将按兵不动，等着敌人断粮挨饿。

sentences.english: There were times during the war when his entire school had no rice to eat.
sentences.chinese: 在抗战时期，他的学校经常断粮。

sentences.english: Soon there would be no food in the city, they said.
sentences.chinese: 他们说城里很快就会断粮了。

definition: out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
to starve to death/to be very hungry
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
beset by hunger and cold (idiom)/starving and freezing/in desperate poverty
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
